#| label: setup

import pandas as pd
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly.express as px

## DCT Platform Market Comparables

```{python}
#| label: market-comparables
#| echo: false

# Data from dfda-cost-benefit-analysis.md
dct_companies = pd.DataFrame({
    'Company': ['Medable', 'Science 37', 'Thread', 'uMotif', 'dFDA (Target)'],
    'Total Raised (Millions)': [521, 40, 50, 25.5, 40],
    'Valuation (Billions)': [2.1, 0.2, 0.25, 0.1, None],
    'Global Reach': ['60+ countries', '10+ countries', '15+ countries', '5+ countries', 'Global target'],
    'Status': ['Market Leader', 'Established', 'Growing', 'Emerging', 'Proposed']
})

# Create bar chart of funding
fig = go.Figure()

colors = ['darkgreen' if x == 'Medable' else 'lightgreen' if x == 'dFDA (Target)' else 'gray'
          for x in dct_companies['Company']]

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(
    x=dct_companies['Company'],
    y=dct_companies['Total Raised (Millions)'],
    marker_color=colors,
    text=[f'${x}M<br>{s}' for x, s in zip(dct_companies['Total Raised (Millions)'],
                                           dct_companies['Status'])],
    textposition='auto'
))

fig.update_layout(
    title='DCT Platform Funding Comparables',
    xaxis_title='Company',
    yaxis_title='Total Capital Raised ($ Millions)',
    height=500,
    annotations=[
        dict(x='Medable', y=521, text='$2.1B Valuation',
             showarrow=True, arrowhead=2, yshift=20)
    ]
)

fig.show()

print("\nKey Insight: Medable's $521M funding proves market appetite for DCT platforms.")
print("dFDA can achieve core functionality with $40M (10x less) through open-source model.")
```

## Executive Implementation Pathways

```{python}
#| label: executive-pathways
#| echo: false

# Funding sources available via executive action
funding_sources = pd.DataFrame({
    'Source': [
        'NIH Common Fund',
        'NIH Office of Director',
        'CMMI (10-year authority)',
        'ARPA-H',
        'FDA Innovation Fund',
        'Total Addressable'
    ],
    'Annual Budget (Millions)': [684, 2300, 1000, 1500, 50, 5534],
    'Redirectable %': [20, 5, 30, 40, 50, None],
    'Potential dFDA Funding': [137, 115, 300, 600, 25, 1177]
})

# Create waterfall of potential funding
fig = go.Figure(go.Waterfall(
    name="Funding",
    orientation="v",
    measure=["relative", "relative", "relative", "relative", "relative", "total"],
    x=funding_sources['Source'][:-1].tolist() + ['Total Potential'],
    y=funding_sources['Potential dFDA Funding'].tolist(),
    textposition="outside",
    text=[f'${x}M' for x in funding_sources['Potential dFDA Funding']],
    connector={"line": {"color": "rgb(63, 63, 63)"}},
    increasing={"marker": {"color": "green"}},
    totals={"marker": {"color": "blue"}}
))

fig.update_layout(
    title='Executive Branch Funding Potential (Without Congress)',
    xaxis_title='Funding Source',
    yaxis_title='Potential Annual Funding ($ Millions)',
    height=500
)

fig.show()

print("\nDOGE Precedent: Executive Order 14158 repurposed existing USDS → DOGE Service")
print("dFDA Strategy: Similar EO could redirect NIH/ARPA-H funds to decentralized trials")
```

## Risk Mitigation Mechanisms

```{python}
#| label: risk-mitigation
#| echo: false

# Risk mitigation strategies from investor-risk-analysis.md
risk_data = pd.DataFrame({
    'Risk Type': [
        'Fundraising Risk',
        'Political Risk',
        'Timeline Risk',
        'Financial Risk',
        'Execution Risk'
    ],
    'Traditional VC Risk Level': [8, 3, 7, 9, 8],
    'dFDA Mitigated Risk': [2, 4, 3, 2, 4],
    'Mitigation Strategy': [
        'Assurance Contract (auto-refund)',
        'Metaculus prediction markets',
        'Front-loaded payouts (2.6x Year 1)',
        'First-loss capital buffer',
        'Open-source + bounties'
    ]
})

# Create radar chart comparing risks
categories = risk_data['Risk Type'].tolist()
categories.append(categories[0])  # Close the polygon

fig = go.Figure()

# Traditional VC risks
traditional = risk_data['Traditional VC Risk Level'].tolist()
traditional.append(traditional[0])

# Mitigated risks
mitigated = risk_data['dFDA Mitigated Risk'].tolist()
mitigated.append(mitigated[0])

fig.add_trace(go.Scatterpolar(
    r=traditional,
    theta=categories,
    fill='toself',
    name='Traditional VC Risk',
    fillcolor='rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.2)',
    line=dict(color='red', width=2)
))

fig.add_trace(go.Scatterpolar(
    r=mitigated,
    theta=categories,
    fill='toself',
    name='dFDA with Mitigation',
    fillcolor='rgba(0, 255, 0, 0.2)',
    line=dict(color='green', width=2)
))

fig.update_layout(
    polar=dict(
        radialaxis=dict(
            visible=True,
            range=[0, 10],
            tickmode='linear',
            tick0=0,
            dtick=2
        )
    ),
    title='Risk Profile: Traditional VC vs dFDA with Mitigation',
    showlegend=True,
    height=500
)

fig.show()

# Display mitigation strategies
print("\n=== Key Risk Mitigation Innovations ===")
for _, row in risk_data.iterrows():
    print(f"\n{row['Risk Type']}: {row['Mitigation Strategy']}")
    reduction = ((row['Traditional VC Risk Level'] - row['dFDA Mitigated Risk']) /
                 row['Traditional VC Risk Level'] * 100)
    print(f"  → Risk reduced by {reduction:.0f}%")
```

## Lobbying ROI Precedent

```{python}
#| label: lobbying-roi
#| echo: false

# Historical lobbying ROI data
lobbying_data = pd.DataFrame({
    'Sector': [
        'Defense Contractors',
        'Pharmaceutical',
        'Oil & Gas',
        'Telecommunications',
        'DIH/dFDA (Projected)'
    ],
    'Lobbying Spend (Billions)': [1.1, 4.5, 2.8, 3.2, 0.1],
    'Government Contracts/Benefits (Billions)': [2020, 450, 320, 280, 27],
    'ROI Ratio': [1836, 100, 114, 88, 270]
})

# Calculate and sort by ROI
lobbying_data = lobbying_data.sort_values('ROI Ratio')

# Create horizontal bar chart
fig = go.Figure(go.Bar(
    y=lobbying_data['Sector'],
    x=lobbying_data['ROI Ratio'],
    orientation='h',
    marker=dict(
        color=lobbying_data['ROI Ratio'],
        colorscale='Viridis',
        showscale=True,
        colorbar=dict(title='ROI Ratio')
    ),
    text=[f'{x}:1' for x in lobbying_data['ROI Ratio']],
    textposition='outside'
))

fig.update_layout(
    title='Lobbying ROI by Sector (Historical Data)',
    xaxis_title='Return on Investment (X:1)',
    yaxis_title='',
    height=400,
    xaxis_type='log',
    annotations=[
        dict(x=1836, y='Defense Contractors',
             text='Military-Industrial Complex:<br>$1.1B → $2.02T',
             showarrow=True, arrowhead=2, xshift=-50)
    ]
)

fig.show()

print("\nKey Precedent: Defense contractors achieve 1,813:1 ROI on lobbying")
print("DIH Strategy: Reverse the cash flow - same mechanism, opposite direction")
```

## Implementation Timeline Scenarios

```{python}
#| label: implementation-timeline
#| echo: false

# Timeline scenarios
scenarios = pd.DataFrame({
    'Approach': ['Legislative', 'Executive Order', 'Hybrid (EO→Congress)'],
    'Time to Launch (Months)': [36, 12, 18],
    'Initial Funding': [27000, 100, 1177],
    'Success Probability': [30, 60, 75],
    'Legal Challenge Risk': [10, 80, 40]
})

# Create grouped bar chart
fig = go.Figure()

metrics = ['Time to Launch (Months)', 'Success Probability', 'Legal Challenge Risk']
colors = ['blue', 'green', 'red']

for i, metric in enumerate(metrics):
    fig.add_trace(go.Bar(
        name=metric,
        x=scenarios['Approach'],
        y=scenarios[metric],
        marker_color=colors[i]
    ))

fig.update_layout(
    title='Implementation Approach Comparison',
    xaxis_title='Implementation Approach',
    yaxis_title='Value',
    barmode='group',
    height=500,
    legend=dict(x=0.7, y=1)
)

fig.show()

print("\nRecommended Strategy: Hybrid Approach")
print("1. Launch via Executive Order (fast, demonstrates value)")
print("2. Build momentum with early wins")
print("3. Secure Congressional funding once proven")
```
